ID.description: Unique identifier of the record, auto-generated by the system.

CLASSIFICATION.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

TYPE.description: The type of this collect or contact request.

ID_PLAN.description: Unique identifier of the parent plan or schedule associated with this request.

PLAN_INDEX.description: Index number for records within a collection plan or schedule.

TASK_ID.description: Task ID associated with this request.

DWELL_ID.description: The dwell ID associated with this request.

ID_SENSOR.description: Unique identifier of the requested/scheduled/planned sensor associated with this request.

ORIG_SENSOR_ID.description: Optional identifier provided by the source to indicate the sensor identifier requested/scheduled/planned for this request.

PRIORITY.description: The priority of the collect request.

TASK_CATEGORY.description: The tasking category associated with this request.

SUFFIX.description: The tasking suffix associated with this request.

UCT_FOLLOW_UP.description: Boolean indicating that this collect request is UCT follow-up.

START_TIME.description: The start time of the collect or contact request window, in ISO 8601 UTC format.

END_TIME.description: The end time of the collect or contact request window, in ISO 8601 UTC format.

NORAD_CAT_ID.description: Satellite/catalog number of the target on-orbit object for this request.

ORIG_OBJECT_ID.description: Optional identifier provided by the data source to indicate the target object of this request.

TASK_GROUP.description: The tasking group to which the target object is assigned.

ORBIT_REGIME.description: The orbit regime of the target.

TARGET_SIZE.description: The minimum object (diameter) size, in meters, to be reported.

RCS_MIN.description: The minimum Radar Cross-Section of the target, in m^2.

RCS.description: The Radar Cross-Section of the target, in m^2.

RCS_MAX.description: The maximum Radar Cross-Section of the target, in m^2.

FREQ_MIN.description: The minimum frequency of interest, in MHz.

FREQ.description: The estimated or expected emission frequency of the target, in MHz.

FREQ_MAX.description: The maximum frequency of interest, in MHz.

VIS_MAG_MIN.description: The minimum estimated or expected visual magnitude of the target, in Magnitudes (M).

VIS_MAG.description: The estimated or expected visual magnitude of the target, in Magnitudes (M).

VIS_MAG_MAX.description: The maximum estimated or expected visual magnitude of the target, in Magnitudes (M).

SPECTRAL_MODEL.description: The spectral model used for the irradiance calculation.

REFLECTANCE.description: The fraction of solar energy reflected from target.

NUM_FRAMES.description: For optical sensors, the requested number of frames to capture at each sensor step.

FRAME_RATE.description: For optical sensors, the frame rate of the camera, in Hz.

INTEGRATION_TIME.description: For optical sensors, the integration time per camera frame, in milliseconds.

NUM_TRACKS.description: The number of requested tracks on the target.

NUM_OBS.description: The number of requested observations on the target.

DURATION.description: The duration of the collect request, in seconds.

SRCH_PATTERN.description: The search pattern to be executed for this request.

SCENARIO.description: Pre-coordinated code, direction, or configuration to be executed by the sensor or site for this collect or contact.

ID_ELSET.description: ID of the Elset of the object associated with this request.

ID_MANIFOLD.description: ID of the Manifold Elset of the object associated with this request.

ID_STATE_VECTOR.description: ID of the State Vector of the object or central vector associated with this request.

ES_ID.description: ID of the Ephemeris Set of the object associated with this request.

EPOCH.description: Epoch time, in ISO 8601 UTC format, of the orbital elements.

SEMI_MAJOR_AXIS.description: The average of the periapsis and apoapsis distances, in kilometers.

ECCENTRICITY.description: The orbital eccentricity of an astronomical object.

INCLINATION.description: The angle, in degrees, between the equator and the orbit plane.

RAAN.description: Right ascension of the ascending node, in degrees.

ARG_OF_PERIGEE.description: The argument of perigee, in degrees.

MEAN_ANOMALY.description: The mean anomaly defines the angular position, in degrees, of the object on its orbital path.

RA.description: The expected or directed right ascension angle, in degrees.

DEC.description: The expected or directed declination angle, in degrees.

AZ.description: The expected or directed azimuth angle, in degrees.

EL.description: The expected or directed elevation angle, in degrees.

RANGE.description: The expected acquisition range or defined center range, in km.

EXTENT_AZ.description: The extent of the azimuth angle, in degrees, from center azimuth.

EXTENT_EL.description: The extent of the elevation angle, in degrees, from center elevation.

EXTENT_RANGE.description: The extent of the range, in km, from center range.

ALT.description: Height above WGS-84 ellipsoid (HAE), in kilometers.

STOP_LAT.description: The stopping WGS-84 latitude of a volume definition, in degrees.

STOP_LON.description: The stopping WGS-84 longitude of a volume definition, in degrees.

STOP_ALT.description: The stopping HAE WGS-84 height above ellipsoid (HAE), in kilometers.

SRCH_INC.description: The maximum inclination, in degrees, to be used in search operations.

X_ANGLE.description: The angular distance, in degrees, in the sensor-x direction from scan center.

Y_ANGLE.description: The angular distance, in degrees, in the sensor-y direction from scan center.

ORIENT_ANGLE.description: The magnitude of rotation, in degrees, between the xAngle direction and locally defined equinoctial plane.

NOTES.description: Notes or comments associated with this request.

ORIGIN.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source.

DATA_MODE.description: Indicator of whether the data is EXERCISE, REAL, SIMULATED, or TEST data.
